title: Elon Musk’s xAI faces second lawsuit over toxic pollutants from datacenter
description: NAACP alleges artificial intelligence firm is violating Clean Air Act and polluting Black communities in Mississippi
content:
Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence company xAI is facing a second lawsuit alleging it is illegally emitting toxic pollutants from its enormous datacenters, which house its supercomputers and run the chatbot Grok.
The new pending suit alleges xAI is ... [3626 chars]

title: Physical AI gaining traction in operations technology: Honeywell's Anant Maheshwari
description: Artificial intelligence is moving beyond IT services, with physical AI gaining traction in operations technology, said Anant Maheshwari of Honeywell at the ET NOW Global Business Summit. AI adds ‘learn’ to systems that ‘see’, ‘think’ and ‘act’. He said it will hasten talent maturity rather than cause job losses.
content:

title: COC employee reps raise concerns about AI for college’s workforce, students
description: Amid conversations about the impact of artificial intelligence on the future of higher education, some College of the Canyons employee representatives are saying they’re foreseeing a “fire hose” of impacts for students and employees.   COC’s Classified Senate President Michael Monsour told the college’s governing board during its monthly business meeting Wednesday he wasn’t confident in […]
content:

title: University of Michigan sued by student accused of using AI to write papers
description: A University of Michigan student is suing the university after being accused of using artificial intelligence to write her papers.
content:
ANN ARBOR, Mich. – A University of Michigan student is suing the university after being accused of using artificial intelligence to write her papers.
The student identified only as Jane Doe says her tone and writing style come from anxiety and OCD, n... [385 chars]

title: As electricity costs rise, everyone wants data centers to pick up their tab. But how?
description: Politicians from President Donald Trump to local lawmakers agree that tech companies should cover the power costs of artificial intelligence data centers
